column2: Might of [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s name has all of the old world in fear.
In his day, [This.GetTitledFirstName] led a Glorius Waaagh against unsuspecting enemy, alas was soundly defeated.
The Everqueen is a respected member of the Ulthuan's council and is responsible for giving sound advice on any matters that the ruler has to deal with.

From the Northern Waste, armies of the Dark Gods would attack the southern lands time and again, slaughtering without reason, pillaging that which is not nailed down, and just simply wreaking wanton destruction to the nations of the Old World. No matter how many of these marauders are killed, no matter how many invasions are pushed back and enemy armies annihilated, the Hordes of Chaos can never truly be defeated, and after a few years of relative peace, they shall once more come down south and begin the vicious cycle once again. So long as there is still Chaos within this world, there will also be those evil and greedy men that are wholly willing to serve them.

The Border Prince Confederacy, known also as the Borderlands, or simply as the Border Princes, is a vast region within the Old World located between the Black Mountains and Black Fire Pass to the north and the shores of the Black Gulf to the south. This region of vast wilderness is home to a multitude of petty Human kingdoms that were established by highly ambitious adventurers who sought to create a realm of their own. Many times, however, these adventurers usually consist of political or religious refugees from lands such as the Empire, Bretonnia and Kislev. As such, these lands are infamous as the homes of a wide variety of bandits, mercenaries, cut-throats, pirates and other lawless fugitives.

The Ancient Forests of the Old World are home to many evil creatures and monsters among them Goblins, Beastmen, Daemons balanced by with benelovent beings making the forest their home aswell such as the Asrai and the spirits and treefolk

The Mighty fortress of Black Crag has seen many Chieftains and warlords lord over it for centuries, with many a warlord facing an untimely end only for it to change hands once again, the Trivial promince of Black Crag has yet again attracted Ire of Many nearby Warlords for their own dominance.

From the deepest, darkest tunnels they came, burrowing and banging, shouting and smashing. We soon learnt not to try to negotiate, save with axes and cannon. For thousands upon thousands of years have we fought them, and many think we will soon be defeated. Yet we have our plans, and some day we will take back our ancestral holds—or else destroy both those homes and the foul Orcs who now pollute them.\n—Gialar Kunst, Dwarf Loremaster.

The Dark Lands is a stark and cheerless place where nature has rent the ground and burst the mountains apart. The volatile land begets Volatile characters, all drawn to challenge the others for one sole reason, Power.

Hexoatl, the City of the Sun located on the Isthmus of Pahuax, guards the lustria from the inevitable chaos. Several adventurers have come to find this area their staging ground forcing Lord Mazdamundi to wake from his long slumber.

In one of your more relaxed days in the warcamp, taking a wrong turn showed a shocking reveal, an Menacing halfling is holding battle stance.\n Laughing it off such predicament initially thinking that no mere halfling could possibly kill you, you are forced to react when he lunges at your chest with his daggers...
Plotting outside your religion group or your culture group affect negatively on your plotting power (For Skaven Affects within culture group)

§Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! has decided it is time for §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! to depart this world. §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! and [From.GetPossPronoun] backers will look for opportunities to kill §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! - the higher the Plot Power, the more likely they are to find openings.
column3: [From.Get_Le_TitledFirstNameJ] a décidé qu'il était grand temps pour [This.Get_le_TitledFirstNameJ] de quitter ce monde. [From.Get_Le_TitledFirstNameJ] et ses partisans vont attendre l'opportunité de tuer [This.Get_le_TitledFirstNameJ] : plus la puissance du complot est élevée, plus ils ont de chance de réussir.
column4: §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! hat entschieden, dass es für §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! an der Zeit ist, diese Welt zu verlassen. Die Unterstützer von §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! werden nach Möglichkeiten Ausschau halten, um §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! zu beseitigen. Je höher die Verschwörungsmacht wird, desto leichter werden sie Wege dafür finden.
column6: §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! ha decidido que es hora de que §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! abandone este mundo. §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! y sus partidarios buscarán oportunidades para matar a §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§!. Cuanto mayor sea la potencia del complot, más probable será encontrar un resquicio.

column2: §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! has been finkin' it is time to sticka §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! in da belly. §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! and [From.GetPossPronoun] fella gits will look for Deir oppoturnity to bash §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s head in - da higher da Plot Power, da more likely dey are to find openin's.
This ancient copper staff is inscribed with the names of all the gods and goddesses of Nehekhara and it grants Khatep mastery of their magical power.
Shaped in the Nebekharan symbol of eternity, the Ankhra surrounds the wearer with protective energies.
This highly ornamented curved blade once belonged to King Ahken of Numas, and its edge shimmers with blue energy that can shatter armor.

Forged from the bronze of Mahrak and, cooled in the blood of the giant Lybrasian scorpion and gilded with red and gold from Lahmia, the ancient breastplate known as the armor of Eternity can turn aside even the strongest blow.

The Flail of Skulls is made from the gilded skulls of conquered enemies, most often kings. Enemies struck by the skulls are lacerated and savaged by their sharpened teeth and bleed profusely from their wounds.

These gleaming, golden weapons represent the high status of the bearer, and all in his presence are humbled by the aura of majesty these weapons convey. Only the most powerful and influential leaders, from the Tomb Kings and the Tomb Princes, can bear these sacred symbols of rulership.
This armor imbues its wearer with ability to continue fighting even when horrendously injured.
Hammer of the Firebeard clan destined to decide the fate of the clan.

Ancient enchanted Dwarfen axe, known as the Axe of Runemasters. Gotrek gained this weapon during his first expedition to Karag Dum, finding it in a cave near the edge of the Chaos Wastes, near a dwarf corpse, later revealed to be the son of King Thangrim Firebeard, Morekai.

The origins of this rune-encrusted item have long been lost, as was the artefact itself until it was recovered by Runesmith Rori Silverbeater from the ruins of Karak Ungor. There are conflicting accounts of its form, some saying that it is a bangle, others that it is a headband or rod, so twisted and scuffed has it become after centuries in the hands of Goblins. However, its magic is still strong and upon the correct words being spoken, the Fiery Thing of Rori gouts forth balls of blue-tinged fire

This large and blood spattered axe, who's name simply means "foe killer", has many charms and pouches chained to its haft. These contain powerful sorceries woven by mighty orc Shamans that enable Grimgor to wield Gitsnik with blinding speed.
Battered, scarred and twisted, just like its wearer, the Blood-Forged armor has served Grimgor well in many battles.
Rouse your Warband in promises for great battles §YExchanges§! Society Currency in favor of Fightiness or Call to Waaagh! and supplements retinues
Rouse your Warband in promises for great battles §YExchanges§! Society Currency in favor of Fightiness or Call to Waaagh! and supplements retinues

Warriors dedicated to god that is primary deity of clobbering, smashing, breaking, killing and pummelling the rest of the world into submission. This is a notion that resonates strongly with the more warlike and highly volatile Orc sub-species, where their single-mindedness for violence and brutality often out-shadows their otherwise low cunning.

Warriors dedicated to god that is the patron deity of cunning and shamans. Whereas Gork is most likely to clobber an enemy god in the face, Mork will happily wait until his enemy's back is turned before raising his club and belting him around the back of the head. It is Mork who is revered by the stranger and arguably more intelligent strains of Greenskins, the most prominent of which are the Goblins and Night Goblins.
The drums of waaagh are bashing in anticipation of many battles to come, causing greenskin flock to this Waaagh.
The tidings in battlefield have made most of the greenskins start slowly losing heart at the ongoing Waaagh... making it harder to get more warriors.
This Warboss's Waaagh has been largely unsucceful causing the greenskins from every ilk view him with distrust and start abandoning the waaagh...
Fightiness is §GGained§! through winning major battles against the defenders during a Waaagh and society decisions. However it is also §RLost§! by losing battles, wars or accepting white peace.
Fightiness is §GGained§! through winning battles, wars, and starting wars. However it is also §RLost§! by losing battles, wars or accepting white peace.

The Fire Mouth is the Ogre God of Fire and Volcanoes, and the supposed offspring of the Great Maw. Every so often the skies of the Ogre Kingdoms are thrown into turmoil, set alight by the volcano the Ogres call the Fire Mouth.
This Character is Easily Swayed by the Necromantic Vampires
This Warboss has taken to liking to master fighting in Forests and Jungles
This Nightgoblin Warboss has taken to liking to master fighting in mountains
This Warboss has taken to liking to master fighting in mountains
This Warboss has taken preferance on open battlefield
This Greenskin Warlord has taken part in great Waaagh!
Hideous and mean, Slaughtermasters are a form of tribal shaman, yet their role is more that of a holy man than magic-user.

Firebellies are the roaring, blazing priests of the Ogre deity known as the Fire Mouth. Bald and broad, they can breathe out a cloud of billowing flame so fierce that it can melt through chainmail in seconds.
Lore of the Great Maw - §GBattle Magic Pool([This.MagicPool.GetValue]/[This.MagicPoolMax.GetValue])§!

simply Gut Magic is quite unlike the arcane arts used by Human wizards. Ogre Butchers use shamanic rites that revolve around devouring parts of their victims, the items acting as fetishes that channel the raw power of the Great Maw.

Red Eye Mountain, formerly known as Karak Ungor, or the Delving Hold is a massive fortress-city of the Night Goblins of the Red Eye Tribe, which was conquered during the onset of the Goblin Wars. At the Dwarfs' height during the Golden Age, Karak Ungor boasted one of the deepest and richest mines in all of Karaz Ankor. As the ore and mineral deposits were finally dug out completely, the Dwarfs simply abandoned the tunnels, never expecting the consequence of such ill-vigilance would have upon their kingdom.

In the dankest parts of the forests or the Badlands lurk beasts that hunt gobbos. These creatures are mostly hunted, in turn, by the Orcs who - if they can't fight each other or da other zoggin' gits - be they stuntie or humie - will scrap with the native fauna for food, for teef and for furs and hides.
When they are not dancing and prancing, Shamans can be quite glum and will reside in isolated, decrepit huts away from the tribe, Allows Recruitment of Shamans.
Forges manned by the infamous black orcs, allways wary of war must learn how to forge their own armor.
The Goblin Tinkerers reside here and invent new ways mechanications to try and defeat their enemies, or themselves.
Hundreds of large arachnid eggs lie dormant in this hive, ready for hatching and to be unleashed.
Grotbag, the mighty goblin warlord machinated the downfall of the great hold of Azril Ungol, with help of the pincer attack of the skaven, eating the dwarfs present.
In -1367IC, Warboss Urk Grimfang led a devestating assault of mount silverspear Slaughtering the remaining dwarven forces, and forcing majority to retreat to Everpeak.
The Grey Dwarfs know him well. Actually, he has caused so many deaths down the years that there are few families who have not lost a relative or friend to Badruk or his boyz.

In his day, Gorbad led a massive invasion that almost crushed the Empire. His armies succeeded in slaying Emperor Sigismund and wiping the Imperial province of Solland off the map, but was grievously wounded at the Battle of Blood Peak.
Morglor the Mangler is one of the most feared weapons ever to be wielded by an Orc warboss. Its thirst for mayhem and death matched only by htat of its owner.

The temple itself is not of Elven design. According to Teclis, the ziggurat echoes the patterns of ancient cities of the Slann. Some think it was they who first contacted Asuryan and taught his worship to the Elves. Up close, the ancient, weathered stones are covered in an ochre moss. For visitors, as the temple rises above them, it can be difficult to tell the real scale of the structure, seeming as though it were part of the cliffs, a mountain that had been partially sculpted by the ancient builders. It was as if the gods themselves had placed it there. Even non-mages can tell that there was a power contained within the Shrine, can sense the energy pulsating out through the very stone. When Teclis and Tyrion visited the Shrine, the former looked as though gazing upon some natural marvel: a mountain landscape, a perfect beach, a glorious sunset. The sixteen year old's face was transformed as if he were looking upon a wonder. Indeed, Teclis claimed he could see the Flame of Asuryan burning through the cliff. He then corrected himself in saying that he not so much saw as "perceived" its energy. In his own words, this was a place where a power from Outside touches the mortal world. Something vast and slow and terribly ancient.

Tor Lithanel started out as a fortified research post within Laurelorn Wood, known as silver wood to the elves, named after the fabled tree of the region. During the war of the beard, as the Asur settlements fell, and their people called back to Ulthuan those who decided to stay flocked to Tor Lithanel, which over time grew into a large city hidden within the ancient forest. Here they were safe from the dwarfs.
The once mighty Fortress City of Gunbad of the Dawi, has been long Lost to the greenskins and their forgings ever prepared for war.

While the bulk of the Dwarf armies were still returning from their victorious campaign against the Elves, disaster came over the Worlds Edge Mountains. Earthquakes covered the mountain passes with rubble, isolating temporarily holds and mines. Gunbad Dwarfs fought valiantly when the Greenskins came, but defeat was inevitable.\n Over two hundred years ago Dwarfs came back to Gunbad in great numbers. Led by Logazor Brightaxe, they managed to retake the mines, but this victory left Gunbad isolated in the midst of a land still riddled with Orcs and Goblins, which turned it into a tempting and vulnerable goal. It was just a matter of time before Dwarfs were forced to relinquish their dominion over Gunbad once more. After this defeat, Dwarfs haven't had enough strength to retake the mines to the East of the Worlds Edge Mountains.

Red Eye Mountain, formerly known as Karak Ungor, or the Delving Hold is a massive fortress-city of the Night Goblins of the Red Eye Tribe, which was conquered during the onset of the Goblin Wars. At the Dwarfs' height during the Golden Age, Karak Ungor boasted one of the deepest and richest mines in all of Karaz Ankor. As the ore and mineral deposits were finally dug out completely, the Dwarfs simply abandoned the tunnels, never expecting the consequence of such ill-vigilance would have upon their kingdom.

Karag Dum was the mightiest of the fortress cities of the dwarfs in the northern lands, standing at the threshold of the Chaos Wastes.  When the armies of Chaos conquered it, Karag Dum and the lands until Blackblood Pass became part of the evershifting lands of the wastes.  King Thangrim Firebeard led the last stand against the armies of Chaos, but was defeated when the leader of the Chaos army summoned a Bloodthirster. He was forced to retreat deeper into the halls along with his surviving warriors. Only a handful of dawi managed to escape the fortress.  Karag Dum became a haven for the forces of Chaos, who used its furnaces for the creation of their own weapons and armor

The Orc stronghold in the north of the Badlands is known as Iron Rock. It is a mountain formed of molten iron, vomited from the bowels of the earth during some ancient upheaval. The Dwarfs first discovered the mountain's rich seams and created a labyrinth of partially finished mineworks, but before they could extract the valuable resources held within, the Orcs arrived. Despite the Dwarfs' continued claim to the mountain, for over 800 years it has remained firmly in Greenskin hands.\n The legendary Warboss, Gorbad Ironclaw, forever secured Iron Rock's dominance of the northern tribes by defeating Crusher Zorgoth and so uniting both Ironclaw and Broken Tooth tribes into a powerful tribal union that has subjugated the area ever since.

sheer cliffs of the Massif Orcal rise above the wild Forest of Châlons and mark the beginning of a rocky highland occupied by Orcs and other monsters. \n It is a barren, desolate place, a blighted region almost devoid of life. Scraggly pines cling to some of the upper heights, and equally sickly-looking brambles creep about the lower slopes, vainly trying to wrest moisture from the thin layer of soil that powders the rocks. It is a miserable region, shunned by the men of Bretonnia. There is no game to be hunted, no mineral wealth to be wrested from the mountains, no fertile land to claim and build upon. Only orcs and goblins call this place home, foul remnants of the once great hordes that had been scoured from the lands of Bretonnia during the founding of the kingdom. The ruined battlements of old watchtowers and keeps built long ago to guard against the threat of Greenskins sometimes loom into view, slowly crumbling away upon distant hilltops, forlorn reminders of a time when the goblins could still sometimes muster great armies to despoil the lands of Quenelles and Bastonne.
The Spider Kult's Hive is a major hive to gather and serve spiders. The largest among them are the Arachnok spiders, bolstered with numerous greenskin protecting them.
A Spider Kult's Hive is a major hive to gather and serve spiders, the largest among being the Arachnok spiders, bolstered with numerous greenskin protecting them.
Ranshackly built Stronghold by the infesting Greenskins to control the area with more brutal effiency in image of tyranny.
Ranshackly built Stronghold by the infesting Greenskins to control the area with more brutal effiency in image of tyranny.

The Ruler, Marshal and Generals can nominate successor from among themselves and Relatives of the Ruler, Advisors are Valid Electors in Kingdom and Empires. Military Command is very Popular among martial Societies.
To Define the attitude towards other Greenskin races within your Personal Horde
Surely Best of the best of lesser greenskin can be used
[Root.Holder.Culture.GetName]s are da best and only one Deserving to be part of da Horde!
The Phoenix Guard are the fearsome guardians of the Shrine of Asuryan, the great pyramid-temple in the Sea of Dreams
Some effort by greenskins have been put to making some sturdy fortifications to dominate the nearby area.
Mines ran by the guild officials from their headquarters
Many Dawi Zharr flock around there to manage their "merchandise"
Slaver's stage raids into the province from here disrupting the local economy

Dwarf society is predicated on Guilds. Of the numerous Dwarf clans that inhabit a hold, many of them will be expert craftsmen in some field and thus belong to the guilds associated with their given profession. Of all the guilds, it is the craft guilds that are the most highly respected and who enjoy a high pecking order in dwarf hierarchy. Goldsmiths, brewmasters, weaponsmiths, runesmiths, jewelsmiths, stonemasons, miners and engineers (one of the most powerful and highly respected craft guilds, whose principal shrine is at Zhufbar) are some of the most esteemed - only members of the royal clan are ranked higher
Ogre society is centered around two important aspects of their culture and way of life
The Mess Hall is the heart of all ogre hordes, it is where they gather to feast, revel, and make merry.
Mead, ale, and beer are all important drinks for an ogre horde. To have a shortage of any of the three would lead to fighting amongst the ogres, instead of fighting other enemies.

Ogres are famously good at two things, eating and looting. They're also quite adept at cobbling together whatever they need from natural resources or the ruins of other civilisations. Building up our foraging parties will ensure that our host has more than enough to go around, whether it be food or weapons.

While wrestling and eating are the more preferred ways of showing who's the boss in an ogre horde, another popular game of skill and strength is to hurl enormous rocks as far as one can. Anyone crushed by the sudden death from above is a welcome snack.
The Ogres are known to tame many of the massive beasts of the mountains of mourn and chaos wastes in battle as mounts or shock forces.
Ogre hosts are known to employ large bands of hobgoblins and gnoblars, acting as fodder, skirmishers, or light cavalry support.

Ironguts wear large, ornamental gut-plates to show off their elite standing, and cover their meaty arms and boulder-like heads in heavy armor plating cobbled together from various conquests over the years.

he Mournfang Cavalry are arguably the heaviest of their kind, the Ogre Kingdoms utilising them to brutal effect as a force of powerful shock cavalry that can literally mow down entire enemy formation in a great, thunderous charge.
Leadbelchers, the Ogre term for both the weapon and the unit that carries them, are the heavy artillery of the Ogre Kingdoms
An Shrine with alot of icons of crude hashut provided by the dawi zharr from their old temples to provide place of worship for the Greenskin slaves.
An outpost that the local Greenskin Satrapy uses to overseer the slaves of province
Moveable Temporary camping place of the Hobgoblin Raiders
An Walled off Cave holding small horde of an Arachnarok Spiders to use for mounts for the local goblin tribe
An Goblin fortress hidden in crevices of local cliffs
Large Gathering of greenskins onto ongoing Waaagh!
Greenskins Arrer Boyz hone their skill with their bows here when not bashing people from afar.
Goblin Slaves attend to the Goblinoid race of squigs here to feed the Waaagh!
Da Effigy of illusava boss from the beyond
Da Effigy of mighta Gork to show how much we can smash gits!
Da Effigy of mighta Mork to show how cunningly much we can smash gits!
Greenskins can Subjugate Smaller and Weaker Greenskin tribes at Whim.
Time to summon da gits to smash up everythin' for gork, mork and §Y$CLAIMANT$§!, they will be krumped!
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! Capable greenskin warlord can take his men and take possession of weaker warlord elsewhere.
Enthrall an Looter to serve your whim from amongst your Horde.
Enthrall an Schemer to serve your whim from amongst your Horde.
Enthrall an Warrior to serve your whim from amongst your Horde.
Have either character have a §RChampion§! Minor title or unlanded §GClan Member§!
Allows occupation of selected area if its not too civilized and establish an greenskin presence
Occupy all De-Jure Barony Titles of [Root.GetBaseName]
Rouse da Gits for an proppa bashin!
You have a direct link with the mysterious forces of the weave. You can use it to call for a spirit host.
Exchanges one tier of special unit producing building in favor for alternative (If Above tier 1)
Grants an landed title to an suitable boss to rule over\n Requires an §MNoble§! with Atleast 10 §KMartial§! or already Rules Over Nearby land
Splits Horde \n Requires an §MNoble of Same Culture§! and with Atleast 10 §KMartial§!
[Root.Society.GetName]My fellow fightas of [Root.Society.GetName] have been questin' yer stupid choice of not choosin proppa enemy to bash.
'Oi! Git over 'ere we got a Bashin' to do, don' care whoz is it.
Let dem come over to uz... we shall sticka in ambush...
'Oi! Those Stuntie gits oughta get bashin!
Tired of annoyin' git [combatant_1.GetBestName] constantly undermining de great [combatant_2.GetBestName], itz time to show him sum good bashin'!
Foolish Git dare to oppose me!

[champion_character.GetTitledName] of [champion_character.Society.GetName] yellz at me. "Oi Panzee, To join our rankz, ya will need to pruuv youself, [Root.GetBoyGirl]", the [champion_character.GetManWoman] says gruffly, foldin' him [champion_character.GetHerHis] armz across [champion_character.GetHerHis] chest. "Ya be fightin' un of our best Boyz. interested, ye git?"
Skah, ain't joinin' sum dum warband!
With the major victory at [Root.Location.GetName] your boyz are praising you!
With the major defeat at [Root.Location.GetName] your boyz are losing faith in you!
With the major victory at [Root.Location.GetName] your boyz are praising you!
Oi! [Root.GetTitledFirstName] when ya gonna take Ladz on proppa Waaagh we been fightin' tirelessly past year we oughta attack meaner gits!
Ya dum gitz i decide when we go to Waaagh!
Alrith Gitz get da muv on we goin bashin everyone! WAAAGH!!!
Why botha to go Waaagh when we can enjoy our spoilz 'ere
With gits comin' from every nearby tribe imagineable to your glorius Warcamp of our great [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick] Warlord, it has become inconvience to maintain too sophistiicated presence.
Everythin' is Perrfec, lez go bashin!
Our Foolish [From.GetTitledNameWithNick] has gone 'an gotten krumped leavin' boyz with out proppa leadership, everyfin' descendin' into anarachy an all dat...
'Oi ya dum gitz! Git over 'ere befur me bash in youz skullz!

With the Relentless approach of the [waagh_warboss_target.GetBestName], the defeats piling, land pillaged and ransacked, the land gets harder to manage with the rampaging hordes around the countryside, we have lost the faith of our vassals to hold the realm Intact.
I Will hold the realm intact even if i have to do it my self!
Truly Grim End for our dear realm
The Grobi have outdone themselves, this warrants entry for Dammaz Kron.
'ow 'as da mighty fallen de puny [waagh_title.GetFullName] is no more, Praize Bigboss [waagh_title.waagh_warboss_target]!
With the high devastation of Waaagh in [waagh_title.GetFullName], the nation has ceased to be able to effectively govern its territories
Our old [From.GetTitledNameWithNick] died, sharing the prestige amongst the remainder of the leadership of the clan

As we camp for the night, mob bearing a torn battle banner approach. Led by the ruthless [holy_order_meeting.GetTitledName], they settle down with us for the night. Just before I was going to sleep, [holy_order_meeting.GetFirstName] asks if I want to stay up and converse with him.
Great chance fur sum headbashing contest!.
How 'bout some of your Ladz join us?
Ya gits, are welcome to waaagh with us!
This Decision is available because you are High enough Rank with 20 Diplomacy or 35 Martial and 500 piety.
With da waaagh goin' well alot of ladz have been arriving at your camp hopin' to get partake in the bashin'
With da waaagh goin' slowz no many of da ladz are showing up anymore at our campz...
With da waaagh goin' well alot of ladz have been arriving at your camp hopin' to get partake in the bashin'
Only my Boyz deserve to fight in me mob!
Let 'em Gits serve unda banner of [Root.GetFirstNameWithNick].
The Momentum of the Waaagh grows stronger... Boldening the Warband

My Warband have succefuly dominated region around [From.GetBaseName], and finally taken the last proper bastion of [overlordship_region.GetBaseName]. If I settled some of my Warband around here they surely would help the ongoing Waaagh!,but the Waaagh leader will not be pleased if I unrightfully take these lands for myself.
[overlordship_region.GetBaseName] sounds like an appropriate part of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! usurps all the titles in the §YDuchy of [overlordship_region.GetBaseName]§!.
I will get one of the Bosses to rule it...

column3: Je n'ai que faire de ces terres.
column4: Ich habe kein Interesse an diesem Land.

column2: [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] will move down to [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] to establizh da spearhead!
The Chief could sure use some help managing his underlings, perhaps you could keep them on track your unrulyness?
[From.GetFirstName] claims he could help you manage your ever growing domain, oi Mighty Leader! you could give him some men to manage.
Skah! get that git far from here!.
§Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! Abandon all [Root.GetHerHis] old provinces to settle down in §Y[overlordship_region.GetBaseName]§!

The [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s have taken [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] and established new strongholds with their soldiers around the area. Though the Waaagh! for [crusade_title.GetName] is still ongoing, the area around [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] is indisputably in the hands of [current_greenskin_beneficiary.GetTitledName].\n\nEmboldened and supported by the new warlord of [overlordship_region.GetBaseName], Greenskins fight harder than ever to devastate [crusade_title.GetName]. It is only a matter of time before the rest of the [crusade_target_ruler.Religion.GetGroupName] realms will fall.

The [From.Religion.GetGroupName]s have taken [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] and settled their soldiers around the area. Though the Waaagh! for [crusade_title.GetName] is still ongoing, the area around [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] is indisputably in the hands of [From.GetTitledName].\n\nThe Greenskins are emboldened and supported by the selfless [From.GetDynName], who abdicated all [From.GetHerHis] old titles to settle down in [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] and take the fight to the [crusade_title.GetAdjective]. It is only a matter of time before the rest of the [crusade_target_ruler.Religion.GetGroupName] realms will fall.

The Greenskin Warlord [From.GetDynName]'s horde have overtaken [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] and claimed them in name of the [from.GetOnlyDynastyName] Dominion, Though the Waaagh! for [crusade_title.GetName] is still ongoing, the area around [overlordship_region.GetBaseName] is indisputably in the hands of [From.GetTitledName].\n\nIt is only a matter of time before the rest of the [crusade_target_ruler.Religion.GetGroupName] realms will fall.
